wikipedia_page.main:
Margaret Ismay was an opera singer. While a student at the Royal Academy of Music, she was awarded the Academy's Gilbert Betjemann Prize "for operatic singing" in 1909. She later had the medal converted into a coin watch by Cartier.She appeared in The Balkan Princess in 1910.
In 2013 her great-nephew showed the medal on an episode of the BBC's Antiques Roadshow.

response: *Paula, Tessa, Carmen, Margherita, Teresa (Other habituées) – Margaret Ismay, Madge Kirkham, Peggy Lorraine, Babs Capelle and Sylvia Beresford
In 2013, the great-nephew of the 1909 recipient, Margaret Ismay, showed her medal on an episode of the BBC's Antiques Roadshow. She had had it converted into a coin watch by Cartier.
